document.title: Arkansas Computer Science and Computing Standards High School Game Development and Design 2020

46434AE20F9D43AD948A61906450864F.description:
Compare and contrast interpreting data, inferring
using data, and implicating with data

7DE576489BE445AA96334BAF12CC73F6.description: Describe the following common types of data bias:

Describe and utilize the concepts of storytelling with
data

4F3282A0BE8F4A2D95BD7EE944254C9B.description:
Communicate basic technical information effectively
to diverse audiences, including but not limited to,
non-technical audience members

917CC6AF19414290ADFDA8DF56B1CFB6.description: Students will demonstrate understanding of storytelling with data and appropriately communicate about technical information.

69E2FECE939B4FEC801B331E4235ED69.description:
Research and identify diverse careers and career
opportunities (e.g., accessibility, availability,
demand) that are influenced by computer science
and the technical and soft skills needed for each

B43A64E03F8E4915BA4C7716351F0305.description:
Research the history of computing devices and their
impact on society

6933BE16CB6C48659C505ACC222DB2A5.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

58502DE899444FF796F9A0E33082C635.description:
Research and describe the relationship between
access and security (e.g., active and passive data,
convenience, data mining, digital marketing, online
wallets, privacy, theft of personal information)

01513CC8CB0245AA8F2401C331E06F70.description:
Research and describe the potential benefits
associated with the utilization and implementation of
social media and other digital technologies

ED629376B42E4222943B1648914887C8.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

51AD30433D77471A99DF0FD351345862.description:
Research and describe the risks and risk mitigation
strategies associated with the utilization and
implementation of social media and other digital
technology implications

26E1F73A6C2D415992CD01D78581CC19.description: Students will analyze the impacts of technology and professionalism within the computing community.

5A5F4E98D3E4468195C69B5CCBA30EFE.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

10B695ED32694F53A14A56853B9C04E7.description:
Identify and describe the purpose of hardware
components within various personal computing
platforms

DA3A5D7B96B74335A59616F619CEEEBF.description:
Classify layers of software (e.g., applications,
drivers, firmware, operating systems) utilized within
various platforms (e.g., Android, ChromeOS, iOS,
Linux, macOS, Windows)

BAFFA234C9614907B2B701647AAE27E9.description:
Research, describe, and utilize at an appropriate
level:

90E341637BCF460DBB378C86229B36A9.description:
Compare and contrast computer programming
paradigms (e.g., functional, imperative, objectoriented)

59D5F52372284F9A82A6FA311CB6E644.description: Students will utilize appropriate hardware and software.

929FF268BA78453CB431E8CC51935406.description:
Describe the importance of creating and using
common rules for communication and the utilization
of common network protocols including the
relationship between client and server

FADAD1AB9EF64857BA87C5DF3C1E1420.description:
Research and describe modems, network interface
cards, routers (e.g., consumer, industrial), switches,
and wireless access points, and identify their
purposes within a network

3F0293B38E884F268A4A74C18BE5C39D.description:
Research and describe common networking
concepts at an introductory level

9A83D6F95C13476DA699CB5E4E33A8EC.description:
Utilize the command line to accomplish common
network troubleshooting tasks at an introductory
leve

CE3B6F01213747E4BE639B2C589E36DB.description: Students will analyze communication methods and systems used to transmit information among computing devices.

BD50A93929644695824CD40161FE4811.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

2A18241EEFD94F5CA136255828FCB257.description:
Research advancing and emerging technologies
(e.g., artificially intelligent agents, blockchain,
extended reality, Internet of Things (IoT), machine
learning, robotics)

90DBE99E9E8C45029BA913EE951A19C3.description:
Identify hardware and software specific to carrying
out the mission of regional industries

87D65E0FBF1046B2A2A2779D3745533F.description: Students will analyze the utilization of computers within industry.

ACB263B7CB494AD6B0D07D5754F32C8B.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

0638A624376D40E9BBA470D8C7A73A87.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 3

2A115DBC4E1D4CD2ABCF02DCC948CDCD.description:
Use a systematic approach to detect logic, runtime,
and syntax errors within a program

1451610C88E74C85A47A01ACDF3B449D.description:
Create programs of level-appropriate complexity
that read from standard input, write to standard
output, read from a file, write to a file, and append to
a file

ED6AE15D276F4BAC8037AEA72BBC81A8.description:
Determine the scope and state of variables declared
in procedures and control structures over time

02304A74BB4B4993AF74FE014C1CC1AA.description:
Discuss and apply best practices of program design
and format (e.g., descriptive names, documentation,
indentation, user experience design, whitespace)

FE45F3C2340F4B318C0EA12D43653F6C.description:
Create programs using procedures to solve
problems of level-appropriate complexity

BC09EF3A92A847E4A7EA2C8E62A11CDE.description: Students will create programs to solve problems.

6C72086DCC4E408CAD5505B410483E90.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

89920E52ACF548BB9B9D9343BF2B7BB1.description:
Use a systematic approach to detect and resolve
errors in a given algorithm

453CC70BFFF84644AF5CF49707254EE8.description: Evaluate the qualities of level-appropriate studentcreated and non-student-created algorithms

7A2DBC52A1424CF0B43D06791E6A5483.description:
Illustrate the flow of execution of algorithms in levelappropriate programs including branching and
looping

6E14757BFB4B4D2A8D615FB2AB3700A0.description:
Design and implement level-appropriate algorithms
that use iteration, selection, and sequence

02D6533184854807A4B123E567400C06.description: Students will create, evaluate, and modify algorithms.

7DA4D3B3AC6B4D118FEFCF6E2A71FFE2.description:
Explain implications related to identification and
responsible reporting of a vulnerability versus
exploitation

FE9185D2EC0E4F5EBC5BE0CF985DEC0C.description:
Research and describe the impacts of ransomware,
trojans, viruses, and other malware

28DEC6D711A04FB4A0D37BA7963A6AC1.description:
Research and describe different roles within the
hacking community (e.g., white hat, black hat, gray
hat hacking), including positive and negative
motivations, significant impacts, and social
stereotypes

98D3D81FA3AE45EABF1F6AB7111AFE26.description:
Identify the five pillars of cybersecurity and evaluate
the relevance of each pillar to computer science
concepts

25F476D683FE409ABDFB44742C6406E1.description: Students will analyze and utilize concepts of cybersecurity.

F71D91CE5CF84D30B9E075E8232B52A7.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

254282B6558D4A1B817FB65C549EC119.description:
Perform level-appropriate data analysis using
computing tools

C6BB66CD773F478CBB31CA70B88723C5.description: Analyze, utilize, and visually represent levelappropriate data

A1EB43FB34F14DD69E1CA42910448047.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

3A618D87BE7D48CABAFEC2E2B37F675B.description: Define and discuss different examples of levelappropriate quantitative and qualitative data

369F57840C664B8CBFDFA44D5783D1FB.description: Define, store, access, and manipulate levelappropriate data (e.g., primitive, linear)

E2220DC4128F4F01A1E919F8784D0B7B.description: Students will analyze and utilize data through the use of computing devices.

F24571D8E5D0494FA0AED1C07A5A91BC.description:
Demonstrate operator precedence in expressions
and statements

0E75B9386300423DAE0C9B8BEE7A6811.description:
Perform operations of level-appropriate complexity
with binary, decimal, and hexadecimal numbers

0F540E1B376F402B9466583FA906B5BF.description: Discuss and apply concepts of abstraction

28104E418E144A7EB068D5CB3DEEB644.description:
Analyze how computer science concepts relate to
the field of mathematics

4E77811725DD4E75BAA160A38C9E92EC.description:
Classify the types of information that can be stored
as variables and analyze the appropriateness of
each (e.g., Booleans, characters, integers, floating
points, strings)

4081493A4D7B4AF6AB247383DFB73263.description:
Interpret relational and logical expressions of levelappropriate complexity using comparison and
Boolean operators

33E3E3F9FE4449418EA52330A314FE8E.description: Students will analyze and utilize connections between concepts of mathematics and computer science.

7C1C86B051F843EEA3447A6C6C0983D4.description: This standard is not specifically required until Year 2

2194230B9E57429C95CBF55141A7D87B.description:
Analyze and utilize level-appropriate troubleshooting
strategies for hardware and software

BED5EBEE78FD40809EAB3A5270735F78.description:
Analyze and utilize collaborative methods in
problem solving of level-appropriate complexity

9F27FB1C88A74B69953AD4FC28D1FD41.description:
Analyze and utilize multiple representations of
problem-solving logic used to solve problems of
appropriate complexity

FCDB6E925B0C4C108DD935B349D8E009.description:
Leverage problem-solving strategies to solve
problems of level-appropriate complexity

72463B4110ED4EBBAD24380670D57B5B.description: Students will analyze and utilize problem-solving strategies.
